1.title: REM Sleep Safety Test App
description: RN-based app with BLE integration and data analysis.
Developed for REM sleep measurement and vagus nerve stimulation devices. (Discontinued)
extraDescription: BLE Integration: Collects data by connecting with REM sleep measurement devices.
Data Analysis: Analyzes collected data to determine sleep safety.

2.title: POWAPOWA Shopping Mall
description: Developed and launched in just 3 days due to the outsourcing company going inactive.
extraDescription: Social login, external payment integration were conducted with direct authorization from the CEO.
Implemented blog and reels review tabs to increase purchase conversion rate.
Created device usage reels auto-play popup script to increase dwell time.
Conducted content creation and optimization for Naver SEO.
Handled all other shopping mall-related development and maintenance.

3.title: Logistics Management Automation System
description: React, Node.js, Supabase-based logistics management automation system.
extraDescription: Addressed the inefficient workflow where shopping mall managers had to manually upload Excel files to update shipping information received from logistics agencies.
Developed using Cafe24 API to allow agencies to directly create/modify shipping information.

4.title: Brand Promotional QR Routine Challenge Web App
description: React-based brand promotional QR routine challenge web app.
extraDescription: Accessible by scanning QR cards provided with brand product purchases. (Also accessible via direct link)
Prevented fraud by fetching internet time based on user's access IP.
Users can enter reward lottery after 2+ consecutive weeks of attendance.

5.title: Emotion Classification & Style Transfer Model
description: Architecture for emotion classification using CNN and style transfer using Neural Style Transfer.
extraDescription: Emotion Classification: Fine-tuned EfficientFace CNN model to classify emotions in given images.
Style Transfer: Fine-tuned AdaIN Neural Style Transfer model to transfer given image styles to 'Inside Out' movie style.
Wrote most of the code including model implementation, testing, and visualization.

6.title: CLIP + BLIP2 Query based Text to Image Retrieval Project
description: Project that finds scenes users want using CLIP + BLIP2.
extraDescription: When user's brief description is input, queries are split via LLM.
Videos are split into p windows and q frames for embedding.
Similarity is extracted by inputting split queries and uniformly sampled frames into CLIP model to select Top K segments.
Selected segments are refined via BLIP2 model to find the segment most similar to the query.

7.title: Dueling DDQN based Pokemon Game Agent Project
description: Project developing a Pokemon game battle agent using Dueling DDQN.
extraDescription: I had already built a simulation environment on the web in a previous project.
Therefore, I reimplemented the same functionality in a completely different language to port to Python.
Developed a Pokemon game battle agent by applying Dueling DDQN algorithm trained on 5M+ battles with 1000+ dimensions per turn.
Achieved ~33% win rate against base hardcoded AI, but 60%+ win rate against general users.

8.title: NOI LAB Brain Report Auto-Generation Script
description: Script that automatically generates systematic reports from various brain capability measurement results.
extraDescription: Designed brain measurement activities together with the CEO and other team members.
Converts results from each activity into scores, then generates report as PDF.
Uploads file to Google Drive to generate download QR code, then creates final PDF with QR code for user to print and download.

9.title: Yakemon: Self-Developed Pokemon Game Agent Project
description: Self-developed Pokemon game simulation web game built with React and TypeScript.
extraDescription: Reduced bandwidth by auto-crawling Pokemon sprite images, converting to webp, and caching.
Implemented 100+ Pokemon characteristics, move effects, and battle logic from scratch without any open source.
Introduced win streak feature with increasingly stronger opponents; no user has achieved 44+ consecutive wins yet.

10.title: UPCY: Reformer & Upcycler Matching Secondhand Clothing Trading Platform
description: React Native-based secondhand clothing trading platform.
extraDescription: Project was under development before I joined the society.
Became tech team leader without handover when the previous leader suddenly left.
Despite this, implemented all app features through steady communication with design, marketing, and research teams.
Proceeded only to TestFlight testing before launch due to business registration and payment issues.

11.title: ACALINK: Web-based Integrated Academy Management Platform
description: Integrated academy management platform developed with React, Node.js, and Supabase.
extraDescription: Identified that many small-to-medium academies lack websites and use Naver Cafe or blogs for promotion with limited effectiveness, leading to multi-tenant SaaS platform development.
Designed platform for principal and teacher convenience based on 3 years of consulting academy experience.
Designed flow for student management, teacher management, real-time sync work schedule, class management, payment management, main page editing so users can manage the site without developers.
Currently collaborating with Daechi-dong consulting academy; planning to expand service.

12.title: Data Visualization: Yonsei University Mileage Simulator
description: Data visualization course project, React-based web app.
extraDescription: Crawled Everytime course review data and Yonsei University course registration mileage data.
Visualized prerequisite relationships by representing courses in graph format.
Allows viewing course reviews, ratings, mileage cut in one screen; well received by students.

13.title: QCNN: Quantum Convolutional Neural Network
description: Project classifying images using QCNN model.
extraDescription: Project classifying AI-generated vs human-generated images.
Implemented model using both Qiskit and Pennylane frameworks.
Built quantum network with 4-12 qubits using Yonsei University's 128-qubit quantum computer, implementing image classification model.
